item.description:
Hike Mt Ascutney in the morning and enjoy the Fest in the afternoon/ or just meet for the hike or fest.

We will hike the beautiful Weatherfield Trail, beginner to moderate in rating. We will hike in and out the same trail about 6.5 miles total distance. The Cascade Falls is 2 miles from the trailhead for a light hike option.

[divider]

The Harpoon Brewery's famous Octoberfest now happens twice a year! Come to the Harpoon Brewery in Windsor, Vermont for our German style Octoberfest. Come enjoy fresh Harpoon Octoberfest beer, German food, and German Oompah music. Ja!

 

What it's all about?

  • A festival of beer, German music, and Fall at the Harpoon Brewery in Vermont
  • Sunday features a Road Race that starts and ends at the annual Octoberfest
  • A wide selection of fresh Harpoon beer including UFO Hefeweizen and IPA.
  • Plenty of delicious German style food sold by a local vendor
  • The best Chicken Dancing this side of the Alps and the famous keg bowling game
  • Featuring an outdoor Bavarian style “Beer Garden”
  • Live music featuring The Jolly Kopperschmidts
  • Free Brewery tours given by the Harpoon brewers all weekend long

 

Event Date (Rain or Shine) - 2011 Dates:

  • Brewery Oktoberfest  time
  • Sunday, October 9th, 12:00 PM to 6:00 PM (RAIN OR SHINE)

 

 

Event Location:

 

  • At the Harpoon Brewery, 336 Ruth Carney Drive, Windsor, VT (off Route 5)
  • Just minutes off Interstate 91, Exit 9 in Windsor, VT
  • About 10 miles south of the intersection of Interstate 89 and 91.
  • Free public parking available in the fields surrounding the Brewery
  • Click Here for Map/Directions

Schedule: (subject to change)

same each day on the stage

  • 12 pm: Doors open, live music from Jolly Kopperschmidts throughout the afternoon
  • 2 pm: Chicken Dancing Contest
  • 3 pm: German Cake-eating Contest (kids first, adults right after)
  • 4 pm: Chicken Dancing Contest
  • 5 pm: German Cake-eating Contest (kids first, adults right after)
  • 5:30 pm: last beer poured
  • 6 pm: end of event

 

 

More Details:

 

  • Door charge is $15.00 per person. This admission fee includes 2 Harpoon beer tickets or non-alcoholic beverage tickets. It does not include food.
  • Must be 21 years or older with proper ID to be served beer
  • Children under 12: admitted free, but must be accompanied by a parent
  • Cash bars serving a selection of delicious fresh Harpoon beer for $4.75 a pint
  • Delicious food sold by a local food provider
  • Tickets not sold in advance, just pay at the entrance when you arrive
  • For more info, call 888-HAR-POON ext 3

 

Designated Drivers:
Remember to plan ahead and figure out how you will be getting home. Harpoon supports a Designated Driver program at each Festival. All designated drivers should visit the Customer Service booth when they arrive at the Festival where they will receive complimentary non-alcoholic beverages.

 

Important Notice about Pets:

Dogs are allowed, but must be leashed at all times. Dog owners are responsible for the actions of their dogs and must clean up after their dogs. Harpoon reserves the right at any time to ask that a dog and its owner leave the event if the dog in not leashed, cleaned up after, or is misbehaving in our opinion. No refunds will be issued if a dog owner and dog are expelled.
item.how_to_find_us: For the hike meet at the park and ride just just past the I91 exit on the EAST side. There are restrooms and gas on the west side of I91. for the Brewery only- Meet at the fest and look for a MEETUP sign. MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR MOBILE # SO WE CAN pH
item.name: Hike Mt Ascutney: Weathersfield Trail & Harpoon Brewery Octoberfest
